data.name: Squadron 42
data.description: Current milestone: SQ42 Q3 2019 ▪ Latest Roadmap Roundup: 02/07/2020 ([more info](https://robertsspaceindustries.com/comm-link?series=roadmap-roundup))
data.body:
---

# Differences Between The Squadron 42 Roadmap & The Persistent Universe Roadmap


# Feature Driven

While the Persistent Universe has shifted to a milestone driven schedule of quarterly installments and we are happy to showcase “work in progress” to our community, the focus for Squadron 42 is to deliver an experience that contains both the narrative and feature scope we envision in one final game. As such, Squadron 42 will only be released when we have achieved our final, polished, creative vision. If there is any slip in our quarterly goals, this will push out for the project’s end date. 

# Feature Complexity

As Squadron 42 is a single player experience, the complexity of some features can be simpler than on the Persistent Universe, where additional considerations need to be made to ensure a fun multiplayer experience; this means that a Squadron 42 feature may complete sooner or have less development tasks than its counterpart on the Persistent Universe roadmap.

# Staffing

Cloud Imperium Games is continuing to expand the team to support our vision.  The Squadron 42 roadmap makes the assumption that certain hiring targets will be hit by the company to ensure that that the team is fully staffed to complete their tasks on time. Delays in hitting our hiring goals, or sudden fluctuations in personnel may cause changes to the roadmap.


# Chapter Considerations

The Chapters outlined on the roadmap represent breaks in the story and script and shouldn’t be considered as “missions” or the same length of gameplay; some are shorter, some longer and will always differ in the amount of work needed. 

# Quality will always be our number one goal.

When we initially set out on this journey, we looked out at the gaming landscape and asked: can we do better? We continue to ask that question about everything we do. As a result, we will ALWAYS extend timelines or re-do features and content if we do not feel they are up to our standards. The freedom to fight for a new level of quality in game development is what crowdfunding has allowed us to do, and we will continue to fight to make sure Star Citizen and Squadron 42 are the best possible games they can be.
 

# Roadmap Focuses On Big Features, But Not Fully Exhaustive 

Behind-the-scenes work, spoiler-specific, and smaller tasks will be happening in addition to the tasks outlined here, as well as on-going improvements to existing features. This is also not intended to be a final list, there will potentially be additional features added down the line and features may shift in their projected release.
 

# Roadmap Data from Internal Project Management Database 

In the spirit of transparency, the data found on this page is pulled directly from JIRA, our internal database that we are using to plan and manage the project. Feature progress and release plans will be updated here in an automated fashion, once per week.

# Future Work Estimates Are Just That: Estimates 

All estimates are based on our knowledge and experience but there are many aspects of game development that are impossible to predict because they literally cover uncharted territory. You will see the same estimates we use in our internal planning, but it is important to understand that in many cases (especially with groundbreaking engineering tasks) these estimates are often subject to change due to unforeseen complexity in implementing the features.


# Internal Schedules Tend To Have Aggressive Dates 

This helps to help the team focus and scope their tasks, especially in the case of tech development. Every team needs target dates, so you may see dates adjust when we get more accurate information and understanding of what’s needed to be completed.

 
# Roadmap Doesn’t Cover Everything

The roadmap is meant to highlight our aims for the remainder of the year on the Squadron 42. Although technology is shared between the two games, this does not currently reflect the Persistent Universe roadmap.


# Terminology

The status of each Feature in the roadmap indicates where it is in the development process. Here is a handy list of terms used on each card and their meaning.


|      |                                      |
| ------------------ | ----------------------------------------------- |
| **Scheduled**          | The feature is planned but not in development.
| **In Development**     | The feature is being actively developed.
| **Completed**          | The feature is considered complete.

cards.name: Shipjacker Medium
cards.description: Implementation of the medium Shipjacker outfit, as well as the loadouts for the characters that require it
cards.body: Concepting, creation, and implementation of the medium Shipjacker outfit, as well as the loadouts for the characters that require it.

cards.name: RTT Comm System Improvements
cards.description: Performance improvements to video-comms rendering
cards.body: Various performance improvements to the video-comms rendering, such as more aggressive culling, more efficient lighting, and using environment probes for background scenes on lower spec machines.

cards.name: Player Vault v2
cards.description: Improvements to the ability for players to leap over obstacles
cards.body: Continued development of the ability for players to vault across obstacles. Utilizing the new motion warping tech for variable width and height obstacles, work will focus on improving the look and feel with better hand placement, landing, and animations, and improving the in-editor tools for designers to make it easier to mark up the environment.

cards.name: Player Mantle v2
cards.description: The ability for players to climb up to elevated surfaces
cards.body: Continued development of the ability for players to mantle up onto obstacles. Utilizing the new motion warping tech for variable height obstacles, work will focus on improving the look and feel with better hand placement and animations, and improving the in-editor tools for designers to make it easier to mark up the environment.

cards.name: New Flight Model AI Port
cards.description: Transition ship behaviors to new flight model
cards.body: Porting all of the existing ship AI functionality from the old flight model to the new one. This will include whatever tweaks are necessary to account for the generally stronger momentum that the ships experience during flight.

cards.name: Water Physics
cards.description: Basic buoyancy for rigid bodies with water flow
cards.body: Building the core tech needed to allow for objects (small objects like crates) to buoy realistically when interacting with water volumes.

cards.name: Distortion Damage Improvements
cards.description: Enabling Distortion damage to work whether used on weapons or on the environment
cards.body: Functionality for distortion damage to correctly impact performance of items and be used via environmental hazard areas.

cards.name: DNA Face Customization
cards.description: Comprehensive facial customization for characters
cards.body: Design and implement the DNA facial system, including the gene-splicing system used for player character customization and nearly-infinite NPC facial variation. Dual quaternion skinning, corrective blendshapes, and all other deformers will be implemented on the GPU to allow the system to scale with many characters.

cards.name: FPS: Collision Avoidance v2
cards.description: The ability for AI to acknowledge objects (both static and dynamic) present on NPC's path and navigate around them efficiently and realistically
cards.body: Adding the ability for AI to acknowledge objects present on an NPC's path and navigate around them efficiently and realistically during the traversal of environments. AI will consider the navigation mesh border segments in the time horizon prediction for collisions. The result of the collision avoidance calculation will then be processed by the smooth locomotion system to make sure that the NPC will look visually accurate in their movement.

cards.name: Hard Surface Shader v2
cards.description: Improvements to hard surface shader to allow greater detail on man-made objects
cards.body: Implementation of multiple improvements to the hard surface shader to provide greater texture detail and a richer feature set allowing more widespread use across the game.

cards.name: Ragdoll Improvements
cards.description: User defined limits and collision for improved articulated entity simulations
cards.body: Improving rag-doll properties such as joint limits, collision, and other physical parameters in order to make the simulation react appropriately and accurately in all situations, including in zero g.

cards.name: Projectile Manager
cards.description: Performance improvements of ship and FPS weapon projectiles in preparation for larger battles
cards.body: Implementing a more optimized and scalable projectile system that will cater to large-scale space battles. This feature will also improve performance in smaller battles as well.

cards.name: Particle Lighting v3
cards.description: Improvements to the lighting system for particles
cards.body: Implementing several improvements to three primary areas of the particle lighting system: The first is to calculate lighting in texture space rather than per-vertex to allow smoother lighting/shadows. Second is to move to a more physically-based approach to directional occlusion for greater quality and consistency with the environmental lighting. Thirdly is to investigate the possibility of volumetric shadowing techniques or approximations to achieve similar visuals.

cards.name: System: Heat
cards.description: Improving the current heat system to support systemic gameplay and customization
cards.body: Improvements to the heat system to provide a more systemic experience between items and vehicles. This will cover a variety of issues and their effect on vehicles, from how heat affects various components in a ship to incorporating heat values into the room system, all the way up to defining the ambient heat of a solar system.

cards.name: Vehicle HUD v2
cards.description: Implementation of scanning and ping features into the vehicle HUD
cards.body: Implementing improvements to the Vehicle HUD system to support additional scanning and ping features, including confidence levels for newly identified objects.

cards.name: Vehicle Radar v2
cards.description: Vehicle radar system updates to support environmental impacts
cards.body: Adjustments to the radar system, allowing the management of different radar upgrades and adding functionality for the developers to modify radar range and abilities based on location. This allows for environmental hazards to impact the radar's effectiveness.

cards.name: New Atmospheric Flight Model
cards.description: Implementation of drag, lift, and turbulence in new flight model
cards.body: The atmospheric flight model is being improved in the new flight model with the addition of drag, uplift, and turbulence. Taking into account the air density, shape, and size of the ship, the feel of flight will be noticeably different from space. For example, wing-based fighters will create substantially more uplift, and in turn maneuver markedly faster, than more brick-shaped ships.

cards.name: New Flight Model
cards.description: Implementation of a fully revised and improved flight model
cards.body:
Initial implementation of the all new in-game flight control system, incorporating a total overhaul to the entire flight experience. For a detailed look at this new system, check out The Principles of Flight panel from CitizenCon 2948 on our YouTube channel. At a high level this covers:

- Rebalanced thruster strengths for more momentum in flight
- Deeper integration with item 2.0 systems such as heat, power, and fuel
- Redesigned throttle for more direct control
- Redesigned afterburner and cruise mode
- Redesigned ESP algorithm 
- New gravlev handling
- Numerous bugs and issues solved with previous flight model

cards.name: Vehicle Scanning v2
cards.description: Updates to the Scanning system, adding the ability to create and detect false signatures
cards.body: Implementation of general user experience improvements to the Vehicle Scanning system. This includes the ability to create false signatures and balancing the distance in which contacts can be detected between pings and scans.

cards.name: Shubin Miner
cards.description: Costume used by Shubin Intersellar miners
cards.body: Concepting, creation, and implementation of the standard miner outfit that will be worn by Shubin Intersellar miners. This will also create variations of the loadout for the individual characters that will wear it in-game.

cards.name: Hover Mode
cards.description: Implementation of a hover mode for ships in gravity that makes special use of VTOL thrusters
cards.body: Hover mode will vastly improve the behavior of ships flying at low speeds in gravity and atmosphere. Players will be able to manually control the state of VTOL thrusters as ships enter a special mode in which players must focus on balancing the ship as it hovers. This will make hovering more realistic  and add depth to atmospheric flight gameplay.

cards.name: AI Spline Paths v2
cards.description: Improvements on the new flight model to allow AI spaceships to request complex commands
cards.body: Implementing all the functionality associated with getting AI ships to follow spline paths using the new flight model. Use cases include following splines for takeoff and landing, landing in a moving ship’s hangar, stunt splines around intricate environments, and ship puppeteering for accurate control of the ship and its thrusters for cinematics.

cards.name: Organic Shader
cards.description: New shader features for rendering rocks, asteroids, and other naturally formed objects
cards.body: Addition of new shader features to our organic shader which will be used for naturally formed objects such as rocks and asteroids. Includes features such as tessellation, displacement mapping, and the physically-based blending of detail layers.

cards.name: Flight: Standard Pilot
cards.description: Creating standard-level flight behavior
cards.body: Creating, implementing, and improving the baseline behaviors for 1v1 dogfighting situations for a pilot of standard skill. These behaviors will appropriately use all basic ship functionality like engaging afterburners, g-force reactions, and various offensive and defensive tactics and maneuvers.

cards.name: Curelife Medical Pen
cards.description: Improvements to the Medpen item
cards.body: The Medpen from CureLife is a complete multi-function individual first-aid system constructed for the rigors of field use. With CureLife’s proprietary serum, a single Medpen will promote healing of non-serious wounds to get you back on your feet. This task covers a rework needed to incorporate the Medpen into medical gameplay.

cards.name: Missile launcher
cards.description: Designing and creating a missile launcher weapon
cards.body: Creating and implementing a high-tech, reusable ground-to-air missile launcher including animation, audio, and balancing.

cards.name: BEHR MK4 Frag Grenade
cards.description: Reworking and implementing the existing frag grenade
cards.body: Rework of the existing fragmentation grenade type, bringing it in line with the current intended weapon spec including all art, audio, VFX, and design elements that are required to get it implemented and balanced in-game.

cards.name: Weapon Effects v2
cards.description: Weapon projectile effects to help combat look and feel more visceral
cards.body: Implementing a series of weapon projectile effect improvements, including a general visual quality increase to make different weapons and energy types more distinct to the player and to help weapon-based combat look and feel more visceral.

cards.name: On Demand Physicalizing v2
cards.description: Refactoring physics calculations into Object Container Streaming system
cards.body: An enhanced piece of core technology tied to Object Container Streaming that will only physicalize objects around the player that are needed. This feature is needed due to the sheer size of the universe and the number of objects in it. Aside from other uses, this will help cut down on the performance requirements and allow for smoother play.

cards.name: Vehicle Scanning v3
cards.description: Continued development of the scanning system for better entity detection and Scanning behavior
cards.body: Under-the-hood infrastructure changes for better entity detection and Scanning behavior, including allowing AI to utilize the Scanning system.

cards.name: Fuel Mechanics v2
cards.description: Implementing new fuel behaviors based on their composition
cards.body: Improving functionality for the vehicle fuel system (including both Hydrogen and Quantum fuel) to work with the new flight model. Some of the work will implement different grades and types of fuel and their associated performance adjustments, as well as scooping fuel from the environment.

cards.name: Vanduul Lance
cards.description: Creation and implementation of alien weapon
cards.body: Creation and implementation of the Vanduul lance. This unique combination weapon can either be used as a spear for melee attacks or fire plasma projectiles to engage enemies at a distance. This task will include all audio, animation, VFX, and balancing required to make this weapon functional in game.

cards.name: Pyro Multi-Tool
cards.description: Design and creation of the versatile Greycat Industrial Pyro Multi-Tool
cards.body: The Pyro from Greycat Industrial is a pistol-sized power tool for the modern space engineer that is capable of charging, cutting, and patching; achieving a multitude of uses thanks to its wide assortment of attachments. This task will focus on creating and implementing the art, audio, animation, VFX, and code necessary to get this item fully-functional in game.

cards.name: Player Carriables v2
cards.description: Allows the player to pick up and carry items
cards.body: Developing the depth, look, and feel of player item handling. Some of the proposed goals for this task include the creation of a carriable tool, setting up key carriable items, and setting up dynamic grips so that the player can correctly hold numerous types of objects.

cards.name: Player Free Look
cards.description: Allowing players greater control of their view
cards.body: This feature will introduce the ability for the player to look away from where their weapon is aiming, thus allowing them to have more situational awareness while keeping their weapon trained on a known threat.

cards.name: Player Jump v2
cards.description: Improvements to the player's jump mechanic
cards.body: Improving the look and feel of the current jump mechanic, including falling and landing, utilizing the new animation time warping tech to reduce the number of animations. Better landing determined by damage caused by the fall.

cards.name: Human AI Combat v2
cards.description: Improving the player PvE experience by implementing a more modular combat behavior
cards.body: The goal is to improve the experience of players when fighting against humanoid NPCs. The team will improve the AI's initial reactions to different type of stimuli (enemy seen, sound heard, ...) and all the systemic transition into those behaviors from the scheduled activities. Also, the combat behavior is going to be refactored to include multiple types of tactics that can be evaluated and selected accordingly to the situation.

cards.name: Power System v2
cards.description: Improvements to support systemic gameplay for power systems
cards.body: Expanding the existing power system to provide systemic connected gameplay in environments and vehicles. Includes connecting the door, lighting, and lift systems to power and dealing with the impacts of EMP.

cards.name: Mission Logic v2
cards.description: Implement additional functionalities to help the design team build the mission flow efficiently
cards.body:
Implementation of the functionalities exposed to the mission system that allow the design team to set up and execute the flow of the different missions that will then converge into the global campaign.
Part of this task will focus on building easier ways for designers to setup the initial scenes. This will include which areas or usables a character should be interested in while performing a specific activity, easier ways to filter game events/callbacks for the specific entities a mission is interested in, and expose more low-level controls to influence the environment based on the mission progression like activating/deactivating QT jump locations for the player.

cards.name: Navmap to Radar v2
cards.description: Upgrades to the in-ship radar map
cards.body: Implementing the Navmap into the radar display of ships to allow for greater fidelity for charting routes and providing information. This work will involve improving the overall interactivity and ease of access into the Navmap display as well as adding new functionality to the Starmap itself. The work will also include improving the contrast of the UI against brighter backdrops and expanding the surface area upon which the auxiliary UI elements are projected.

cards.name: Usables v2
cards.description: Improve the usable system performances and expand functionalities for designers to easily manage/create a wide variety of interactive objects
cards.body: Improving the usables system to allow AI characters to interact with objects in a more believable way. Since there are thousands of NPCs populating the game's locations, the goal is to have them interact with each other or the player in a meaningful way as part of their day-to-day routines. We are planning to expand the usable system to correctly support the ability to override how to perform an action based on where the users are (for example, serving an NPC in the mess hall of an Idris will result in a different action compared to serving the player in a shop on a planet, but the basic functionality will be the same). We are also connecting usables to other usables without the need to create multiple entries. For example, allowing a table to have different numbers of chairs attached to it, without blocking the NPC's ability to stand at the table when a chair is not available.

cards.name: Aegis Idris-M
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Idris-M
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the Aegis Idris-M, a military frigate used in the story of Squadron 42, including specific performance capture scene integrations and associated gameplay.

cards.name: Aegis Javelin
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Aegis Javelin destroyer
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete Aegis Dynamic's military destroyer, the Javelin, for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: Titan Suit
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Titan Suit
cards.body: Creation of the Titan exosuit. Originally built for industrial purposes, it has expanded to military and combat operations as well. Though it will exist in the PU, this version will have elements specific to Squadron 42. Aside from the art and animation involved in creating the Titan, this task will cover the design work needed to build the suit functionality and balance it in a combat space.

cards.name: HDR Color Processing
cards.description: Color processing and core-tech required for HDR monitor output
cards.body: Developing the core tech for the processes and reproduction of colors in game. Work on this feature will include adding HDR color correction, improvements to the exposure system, studying how we can achieve physically accurate light intensities, and finally allowing HDR monitor output.

cards.name: Gas Cloud VFX Improvements
cards.description: Implement a series of improvements to gas cloud VFX
cards.body: Implementing a series of improvements to the gas cloud VFX, expanding on the existing data-driven system to allow effects to visually reflect the conditions of the gas cloud. This will also build out the tool-set to allow artists and designers to dynamically control these effects.

cards.name: FPS Stealth v2
cards.description: Stealth gameplay mechanics
cards.body: Adding NPC behaviors that allow for a player to approach an encounter using stealth tactics. This also allows for the NPC to react appropriately and realistically as they search for potential intruders, identify corpses, and transition between low and medium threat levels.

cards.name: Flight: Ace Pilot
cards.description: Creating ace-level flight behavior
cards.body: Implementing the functionality for veteran or ace-level combat pilots. Some of the behaviors will include decoupling, ship loadout-based behavior, or cleverly using the environment in their tactics.

cards.name: Atmospheric Effects v2
cards.description: Improvements to atmospheric flight effects, including entry, exit, and contrails
cards.body: Implementing a series of improvements to the atmospheric flight effects, including smoother, systemic transitions from space to atmosphere, contrails variance within a gas cloud, improved turbulence effects, and use of signed distance fields for atmospheric burn effects.

cards.name: Flight: Landing, Take-Off, and Travel
cards.description: Behaviors that allows for AI to take off and land with the new flight model
cards.body: Utilizing the new flight model to improve spline-following functionality and allowing for AI pilots in ships to land on and take off from carriers, hangars, or landing pads, and perform basic non-combat maneuvers, like patrolling.

cards.name: Physical Damage System
cards.description: Softbody collision simulation on rigid objects
cards.body: Making use of the physics engine to create a system that looks spectacular as well as behaves realistically when large objects such as ships are being damaged by weaponry or colliding with other ships, locations, or even planets.

cards.name: Conversation System Improvements
cards.description: The system by which players and NPCs interact
cards.body: Continued development of the the conversation system used by players and NPCs to interact. Some of the work associated with it will include smoother animation transitions, code support, and UI adjustments.

cards.name: Cloth Sim v2
cards.description: Improvements to in-game cloth, ropes, and softbody entities
cards.body: Making improvements to in-game cloth, ropes, and softbody entities, including dynamic physicalized animations based on environmental effects like wind, as well as collisions.

cards.name: Vents/Hatches
cards.description: Setup of doors, airlocks, and hatches to be interactable by the player and AI
cards.body: Setup and improvements of character and AI door use, as well as hatch and airlock use.

cards.name: Shield Effects v2
cards.description: Implement a series of improvements to vehicle shield effects
cards.body: Implementing improvements including the use of particles with signed distance fields to allow shields to more closely conform to the shape of the vehicle, allowing better visibility at distance, specific effects to show it powering on and off, creating clearer visual cues that the shield is being damaged, and its overall health.

cards.name: Flight: Gunships
cards.description: Implementation of more specific flight behavior for gunship crew members to make better usage of turrets and gimbal weapons
cards.body: Implementation of specific behavior for pilots of ships that are heavily reliant on turrets. This functionality will allow them to include behaviors to focus on their damage output by bringing as much firepower to bear as possible while maintaining optimal distance and optimizing shield face exposure.

cards.name: Ship AI 3D Pathfinding v2
cards.description: Basic technology for spaceships to efficiently navigate through space using physics grids
cards.body: Building the foundational technology that allows AI to navigate in 3D space by utilizing the physics grid. The path search will be hierarchical and will not only use the physical data but also other factors, for example, the graph connection of the QT points. When complete, this system will scale to the size of the universe and be able to accommodate all content such as asteroid fields, planets, space stations, etc.

cards.name: Save / Load
cards.description: Setup of save system across the game
cards.body: This feature will handle the creation of the save system across the game, including player data, checkpoints, and UI. Part of this system will also seek to understand how the game stores and loads dynamic entities, NPC positions, and data associated with object containers.

cards.name: Player Interaction System Improvements
cards.description: The system that allows the player to interact with the game
cards.body: Continued development of the interaction system that lets the player select dialogue options, interact with props in the environment, and generally interact with the game. Some of the tasks included in this work will include providing player feedback for when items can't be used, adjusting UI elements to scale/place correctly with geometry, and bind commonly used actions to hotkeys.

cards.name: Greycat Industrial Cydnus
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Cydnus mining vessel
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the Cydnus, a massive mining machine known colloquially as the 'mining tick', for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: Walk and Talk
cards.description: System and animations to support NPCs being able to walk alongside the Player or other NPCs and maintain a believable conversation
cards.body: Building the system and animations needed to support NPCs being able to walk alongside the player or other NPCs and maintain a believable conversation while traveling to a destination. This feature will create the ability to mark animations so that AI can restart them from the appropriate section or avoid obstacles. The same functionality will be extended to on-foot or in-ships patrols, guarding behaviors, and so on.

cards.name: Vanduul Cleaver
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Vanduul Cleaver boarding ship
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the fearsome Vanduul boarding ship, the Cleaver, for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: Procedural Asteroids v2
cards.description: Asteroid field generation and visual improvements
cards.body: Continued development of the system that determines the shape, distribution, and appearance of asteroid fields. Some of the tasks that will be included will be looking at adding volumetric fog elements, minable entities, and creating ring patterns.

cards.name: FPS Close Combat
cards.description: Implementation of close combat mechanics
cards.body: Improvement and extensions to the look and feel of the current takedown mechanic, allowing stealth kills with both a knife and bare hands. This work also implements close melee combat, again both punching with bare hands or stabs with knives or other sharp objects.

cards.name: Vanduul Void
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Vanduul Void bomber
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the Void, a devestating Vanduul bomber, for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: Player Status System V1
cards.description: Core mechanics to track player status and well-being
cards.body: The player status tracks the various well-being attributes of a character, including health, stamina, and oxygen levels. This will be expanded to include thirst, hunger and temperature. These values will have knock-on effects for player stamina and ability and can be used by the AI behaviors to make intelligent decisions based on their own condition or the condition of others.

cards.name: Vanduul Driller
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Vanduul Driller capital ship
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the fearsome Vanduul capital ship, the Driller, for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: Drake Cutlass Red
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Cutlass Red
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the Cutlass Red (the medical ambulance variant of the Cutlass) for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: MISC Hull-C
cards.description: The third size in MISC's line of dedicated cargo haulers
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the Hull C for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: Vanduul Kingship
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Vanduul Kingship
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the fearsome Vanduul capital Kingship for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: Vanduul Stinger
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Vanduul Stinger fighter
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the fearsome Vanduul heavy fighter, the Stinger, for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: Weapon Racks
cards.description: Adding weapons storage functionality to ship hulls
cards.body: Adding additional gameplay features to some ships, such as a usable weapons rack, where the Player can store small arms in an external bay for use on missions.

cards.name: Vanduul Hunter
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Vanduul Hunter corvette
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the fearsome Vanduul corvette, the Hunter, for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: RSI Bengal
cards.description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Bengal carrier
cards.body: Work necessary from the vehicle team to complete the Bengal for use in the story of Squadron 42.

cards.name: General Rendering Performance Improvements
cards.description: Various optimizations to improve rendering performance
cards.body: Improving the render thread performance which will cut down on CPU footage. Some of the goals in this feature work will include 4K resolution support, support for static render-to-texture surfaces, and improvements to the occlusion system.

cards.name: Image Quality & Cinematic Rendering Improvements
cards.description: Improvements to the cinematic image capture system
cards.body: Continued development of the cinematic rendering. Some of the tasks include a new depth-of-field technique, temporal super-sampling for high quality anti-aliased cinematics, and multi-frame image capture for super-high resolution output.

cards.name: Mesh & Geometry Streaming Improvements
cards.description: Improvements to the mesh & texture streaming systems to allow greater detail for less memory
cards.body: Efficiency improvements to the mesh & texture streaming systems to provide greater detail with lower memory usage. This will be achieved through a new shared set of logic as to how we prioritize different assets to achieve a balance between detail and memory usage proportional to the available video memory that can scale all the way from very low to very high spec.

cards.name: FPS: Cover Usage v1
cards.description: The ability for NPCs to use environmental elements as partial cover when engaging an enemy
cards.body: Expanding the tactic selection for the NPC-Human Combat to analyse the environment and detect, in absence of full cover, possible positions where they can engage enemies without being fully exposed to them. This includes objects such as small crates, which could potentially provide partial cover.

cards.name: Real Time Reflection Improvements
cards.description: Improved screen-space reflections and support for mirrors via render-to-texture
cards.body: New implementation of screen space reflections to better handle glossy surfaces and disocclusion. Add support for renderer to support 'mirrored' cameras to allow render-to-texture to be used for accurate mirror reflections (where performance allows).

cards.name: FPS: Stealth v3
cards.description: Improvements to AI stealth protocol while hunting and pursuing players
cards.body: Improvements to AI stealth protocol while hunting and pursuing players who are hiding or retreating.

cards.name: FPS: Navigation v2
cards.description: Implement the basic functionalities for NPCs to move and transition between different types of navigation
cards.body: This feature allows NPCs to construct paths for traversing the environment utilizing multiple types of navigation. For example, NPCs will understand how to move from the internal part of a spaceship to open space and then traverse a zero-g environment. In this scenario, the path will be constructed in different sections: one to reach the airlock, one to navigate through the airlock using the correct actions, and one to EVA to the final location. The basic functionalities include locating potential connections provided by elevators, transit systems, and airlocks and allowing the pathfinder to automatically use those elements. The hierarchical pathfinder will make use of different forms of pathfinding for varying environments (one for the open space, similar to spaceships, one for the navigation meshes, and so on), to build a path that represents  global movement.

cards.name: Basilisk Armor - Advocacy
cards.description: An Advocacy-branded version of the Basilisk body armor
cards.body: Concepting, creation, and implementation of the Basilisk light body armor that will be worn by the Advocacy. This will also cover the creation of the loadout for the individual characters that will wear it in-game.

cards.name: FPS: Realistic Firing v2
cards.description: Improving FPS combat behaviors so that NPCs will choose appropriate weapons and tactics
cards.body: Adding the ability for NPCs to evaluate their proficiency with different weapons, use the one best suited to the situation, and employ appropriate tactics when facing the enemy and managing ammunition.

cards.name: Large Scale Shadow Improvements
cards.description: Improvements to shadow system to allow multiple large-scale shadow maps
cards.body: Improvements to the shadow system to allow multiple large-scale shadow maps as opposed to the single large-scale map we currently use. This task would also include support for large-scale shadows to be dynamic for use on capital ships.

cards.name: Gunner
cards.description: Implementation of the Naval Gunner outfit
cards.body: Concepting, creation, and implementation of the Naval Gunner outfit and the loadouts for the characters that require it.

cards.name: FPS Combat Weapon Types
cards.description: The ability for the combat AI to engage the player using a wide arsenal of weaponry
cards.body: Adding the ability for the combat AI to engage the player using a whole arsenal of weaponry, reacting dynamically to both player behavior and the environment, and engaging strategically and realistically.

cards.name: Physics Queue Refactor
cards.description: More efficient physics processing and parallelization to take advantage of client's computing power
cards.body: Rebuilding the game's basic physics engine to accommodate the scale of the game and perform to the highest degree while delivering a believable physics simulation for all areas.

cards.name: FPS: Combat Behaviors v2
cards.description: Improvements to FPS combat, allowing NPCs to fight in a more believable way
cards.body: Creating varied and believable combat behaviors for enemy AI to adopt in battle. The AI will not only use a variety of weapons to create different combat situations but will also have different ways of engaging the player, whether in groups or solo. This task will also include creating varying levels of combat training and skill sets for certain areas or situations that the player will encounter.

cards.name: Body Dragging
cards.description: A character pulls another prone character
cards.body: Implementing the initial functionality for the player to move an incapacitated or dead NPC by dragging the body around an environment.

cards.name: Death Animations Improvements
cards.description: Combining Animation with Physical Ragdoll Simulation
cards.body: Combining the updated ragdoll properties with the animation system to make the death reactions of players and NPCs look much more realistic. This will be achieved by blending death animations with physical ragdoll simulation.

cards.name: Flight: Wingman Commands
cards.description: Functionality for a wingman to receive and handle the player's commands
cards.body: Implementing functionality for a wingman to receive and handle the player's commands. The different commands will result in modification of the systemic behaviors or their execution, so that the wingmen will be able to correctly help the player and match their play-style.

cards.name: Object Push and Pull
cards.description: Allow players to push and pull objects
cards.body: This mechanic allows players to grab larger objects and move them around an environment by either pulling the object behind them or pushing it in front of them.

cards.name: Zero-G Push and Pull
cards.description: Zero-G traversal without EVA, using player's hands
cards.body: Adding the ability for the player to traverse along surfaces in zero-g by pushing and pulling with their hands. This will come into play in situations where the player isn't wearing an EVA suit with thrusters, or as an alternative traversal method if thrusters are turned off.

cards.name: NPC Healing
cards.description: Healing other players and NPCs
cards.body: Expanding the healing gameplay to allow the player to use items with healing properties (like the MediPen) on other players or NPCs.

cards.name: Shipjacker Heavy
cards.description: Design and creation for the heavy Shipjacker armor
cards.body: Design and implementation of the Shipjacker heavy armor. Work will also include the rigging and balancing of the armor for specific combat experiences.

cards.name: Flight: Atmospheric Combat
cards.description: Functionalities allowing AI pilots to take advantage of planetary data and fight inside the atmosphere
cards.body: Giving AI ships the proper functionality and behavior to navigate and fight in atmosphere by taking into account concepts like lift, drag, or energy potential into their flying. It will also allow ships to correctly handle the terrain layout and objects on planets.

cards.name: FPS: Cover Usage v2
cards.description: The ability for AI to strategically use dynamic cover and react to the modification of the environment
cards.body:
Expanding the cover system to correctly evaluate dynamic cover in the environmental queries used by the AI behaviors. Dynamic cover could either be destructible objects or environmental elements that can be manipulated to be used as cover. Players will also be able to destroy objects in the world while NPCs are using them as cover, and this work will implement specific behavior to detect these situations and react accordingly. 

When no viable cover is available, NPCs will also attempt to search for potential objects that can be used as cover. For example, panels that can be raised from the ground and used for protection. This feature will also include new ways for characters to enter/exit cover locations, such as sliding when sprinting, or vaulting over a low cover object.

cards.name: Flight: Mission logic additional controls
cards.description: Implement additional commands designers or players can impart to AI spaceship crew members
cards.body: Implementation of basic functionality allowing mission designers to impart commands to an AI spaceship crew as a player would. For example, we will implement interfaces that allow designers to request ship AIs to defend other ships or lead/follow another ship while flying over user-defined splines. We will also implement abilities for designers to specify dangerous areas the AIs should try to avoid.

cards.name: Basilisk Deployable Shield
cards.description: A mobile shield system designed for quick deployment in combat
cards.body: Building the visuals and functionality of a deployable shield that can be carried on the belt. Once activated, it will create a temporary shield, capable of absorbing incoming damage from bullets and other projectiles, protecting the player behind it. This will include all art, audio, VFX, and design tasks needed to get the item implemented and balanced in game.

cards.name: Flight: Mission Improvements v2
cards.description: Flight behaviors that affect mission flow
cards.body: Implementing advanced mission-related functionality for AI NPCs. This will include behaviors like docking, radar usage, or anti-personnel protocol for combat ships.

cards.name: Core AI Improvements
cards.description: Optimization and improvement of the current AI system to correctly support all the functionalities required by NPCs
cards.body: Core underlying systems for every AI in the game, from combat, to standard NPCs, to ships. This includes optimizing the current system by speeding up the navigation mesh generation, supporting complex objects to navigate throughout the world (airlocks, transit systems, elevators, etc.) and allowing behaviors to correctly and smoothly transition between trackview-scenes (where designers can control, for example, exactly which animation to play) and systemic activities.

cards.name: Weapon and Item Customization
cards.description: Manipulation of held items with attachments and sub-items
cards.body: This feature will add the ability for players to customize some weapons and items while in inspect mode using attachments, components, and sub-items. For example, adding or removing a silencer, changing the scope of a gun, or changing batteries in a radio.

cards.name: Flight: Formations
cards.description: Functionality to allow AI spaceships to fly as part of a formation
cards.body: Allowing for multiple AI ships, as well as the player, to fly in preset formations both as leader or follower. These flight patterns will adjust according to the participating ships' specs, such as speed, agility, and size.

cards.name: Social AI v2
cards.description: Implementation of improvements to peaceful AI behaviors
cards.body:
Populating the game world with NPCs who have different behaviors, resulting in a living and breathing environment. They will be able to interact with complex objects like food machines, carts, or airlocks, and each other. They will also keep track of their relationships so that a player can behave differently and influence their reactions and decisions.

Characters will be able to use more dynamic conversations between each other and with the player, and those conversations will be influenced by player actions. NPC behaviors will also be influenced by dynamic events in the world. For example, if an electric panel fails, engineers will organize a repair.

cards.name: FPS: Grenades
cards.description: Basic functionalities to allow NPCs to use grenades and incorporate them into the flow of their combat behavior
cards.body: Adding grenade combat and reaction mechanics to enable AI to use grenades strategically (clearing out areas, creating diversions, crowd control, etc.) and react when players use them as such. This is a combination of implementing core functionalities, like predicting the strength and direction the NPC applies to the grenade throw, along with incorporating this action into their behavior so they can anticipate the right moment in which this attack should be used.

cards.name: Vanduul Combat Behavior
cards.description: Foundational tech to enable unique behavior and attack patterns for Vanduul
cards.body: Foundational tech to enable unique behavior and attack patterns for the Vanduul. These fierce aliens have unique and unpredictable combat behaviors, requiring specific technical needs different from human characters.

cards.name: Mounted Guns
cards.description: Ability to use mounted guns on vehicles
cards.body: Further expanding the player's arsenal by allowing them to take control of a mounted gun on either a vehicle or the ground. These types of weapons will offer greater firepower and stability than standard FPS weapons but at the cost of the mobility associated with personal weapons.

cards.name: Mag Boots
cards.description: Player locomotion across a surface while in zero-g
cards.body: Creating functionality allowing players and NPCs to traverse a surface in zero-g as if it is normal ground. This will be accomplished by using the thruster pack to simulate limited artificial gravity, allowing players to walk on walls in areas that don't have gravity.

cards.name: Locomotion v2
cards.description: Improving locomotion sets for player movement
cards.body: Continue improvements to the look and feel of player locomotion, specifically augmenting standing and crouched stances (both with and without a weapon equipped) to create a smoother player movement experience.

cards.name: FPS: Close Combat
cards.description: Implement behaviors for melee-ranged fight, using fists, weapons or knives
cards.body: Developing enemy AI behaviors to engage the player in close combat. The goal is to create an experience where combat AI will remain lethal even if they lose their guns or run out of ammo, as they will be able to fight the player with knives or bare hands.

cards.name: Seated Item Handling
cards.description: Weapon handling while seated in a vehicle
cards.body: This feature will add the ability for the player and NPCs to use smaller weapons while seated in a passenger seat of a vehicle or ship.

cards.name: FPS: Titan
cards.description: Specific enemy AI behaviors for a more fulfilling combat experience
cards.body: Creating a full combat behavior for enemy AI to utilize when engaging the player. The Titan is a large exosuit that presents a unique set of challenges both in development and in-game that will differentiate it from normal combat encounters.

cards.name: Cockpit Interaction
cards.description: Functionality enabling physical player interaction with cockpit items
cards.body: Adding more visual animations for the player to use when interacting with buttons and switches in a ship cockpit. This will also include interactions with other machines and items in the game such as locker doors and more.

cards.name: Player Slide
cards.description: The ability for the player to enter a slide
cards.body: This feature will introduce a new traversal method for players, allowing them to traverse short distances by sliding along the floor. This will add a new element to combat spaces.

cards.name: Companion AI
cards.description: AI Behaviors for friendly and enemy NPCs to work together and/or with you
cards.body: Developing the ability for the player to fight alongside a companion NPC. The goal is to create a system in which you will be given the chance to have a companion that you can actively direct, but that is also smart enough to guide the player, support them in firefights, and potentially provide ammunition or health packs, to lead the mission to success.

cards.name: Player Swim
cards.description: Traversal within a liquid environment
cards.body: Creating basic functionality for the player to be able to swim across the surface of bodies of water, including related features such as entering, exiting, and drowning. This work will also include support for hazardous liquids that can damage or kill the player and other characters.

cards.name: Player Locomotion Stairs Improvements
cards.description: Improved character locomotion up and down stairs
cards.body: Improving the look of characters, both the player and NPCs, moving up and down stairs. This will include new stair ascending/descending animations depending on walk/run/sprint, characters looking where they're going, and procedural foot alignment to hit each stair correctly.

cards.name: Beta
cards.description: The final stage of polishing and bug fixing before release
cards.body: At this stage, the game is close to complete. This final pass will fix any lingering bugs and address remaining feedback before official release.
